address.street: Albright Patents LLP Eagle Tower Montpellier Drive

description.p: The present invention relates to a child's toy which has a plurality of uses.

A parent with a new baby or infant is often laden down with many different items and products when making even the shortest of trips or excursions. These items include baby toys, cleaning equipment and often also cold weather garments depending on the season.

US7144359 discloses a child's blanket which can be configured as a character. The blanket is provided as a flexible planar item and can be folded and manipulated so as to take on the appearance of a character having a body formed by the folded blanket. The body of the character has at least one feature which defines the appearance of the character.
The present invention seeks to relieve some of the aforementioned burden associated with the provision of many different baby items and products.

According to a the present invention, there is provided a child's toy comprising a distinct head, a foldable body having a top, bottom and opposing sides, the head being attached to the top of the foldable body, and at least one fastener for releasably retaining the body in its folded condition, the head including at least one facial feature, and the body when unfolded presenting a pliantly flexible changing mat element on one major surface and a pliantly flexible play mat element on the opposite major surface, the play mat element including at least one play element for a child to interact with, characterised in that the body, when folded, provides a muff with opposing side openings for hands insertion, whilst the head is positioned at the top of the body.
Preferable and/or optional features of the invention are set forth in claims 2 to 14, inclusive.
Referring to the drawings, there is shown an embodiment of a child's toy 10 which, in this case, represents a soft cuddly bear. However, any animal, human or alien form may be represented.

The child's toy 10 comprises a head portion 12, body portion 14, two arm members 16 and two leg members 18. The head portion 12 includes one or more facial features 20 and/or expressions, and in this case has two eyes 22, a nose 24, a mouth 26 and two ears 28. The head portion 12 is formed from pliantly flexible material, such as a natural or synthetic fabric, which is stitched and stuffed to produce a soft padded generally rounded head.

The body portion 14 is formed a pliantly flexible sheet of material having at least first and second overlying layers 30, 32 superposed on each other and connected via a stitched seam at the perimeter edge 34. The first layer 30 is preferably formed of a natural or synthetic fabric, and the second layer 32 is preferably formed of a plastics material which can be wiped clean. The first and second layers 30, 32 are substantially square having perimeter sides of substantially equal lengths. The first layer 30 can be considered as being a three by three grid of nine equal square segments 36, for reasons which will become apparent hereinafter.

The first layer 30 presents a first major surface 38 and includes at least one play element 40 attached thereto for occupying a small child. A plurality of play elements can be provided, and preferably each play element occupies no more than one of the said segments 36 of the first layer 30, thereby allowing simplified folding as will be described hereinafter. The play element 40 may include at least one reflective element, rattle, ring, bell, tactile material, ribbon, button and/or picture to interest a child. The first layer 30 thus presents a play mat element 42 when placed face up.

The second layer 32, due to the use of a wipe-clean plastics material, presents a changing mat element 44 on a second major surface 46 opposite the first major surface 38. The plastics material is non-permeable to prevent or limit seepage of faecal matter and urine.
The head portion 12 is, typically permanently attached, for example via stitching, at its base midway along one of the perimeter edges 34 of the unfolded body portion 14.

The arm members 16 are elongate generally tubular pocket elements, preferably formed from natural or synthetic fabric and in this case similar to the head portion 12. Each arm member 16 is stuffed with wading and stitched to close the arm member 16 at its proximal end 48. The proximal end 48 is connected to the outer surface 50 of the first layer 30 of the body portion 14 approximately one third of the way inwards from the side perimeter edge 52 of the first layer 30 and so that the arm member 16 faces laterally and substantially perpendicularly away from the sagittal plane bisecting the head portion 12. The arm member 16 can thus hinge about the connection at the proximal end 48. The arm member 16 is also positioned adjacent the top perimeter edge 54 of the unfolded body portion 14 so that the lateral extent of the arm member 16 is substantially parallel with the sagittal plane. The longitudinal extents of the arm members 16 are substantially coaxial, and the arm members 16 extend in opposite directions relative to each other so as to lie across respective uppermost and outermost segments 56.

The leg members 18 are similar in construction to the arm members 16, being elongate and generally tubular pockets. The proximal ends 58 are stitched closed to prevent the wading escaping, and are attached at a top edge of the central segment 60 of the first layer 30 of the body portion 14. The leg members 18 thus hinge about the connection at the proximal ends 58. A longitudinal extent of each leg member 18 extends substantially in parallel with the sagittal plane, and the leg members 18 are positioned generally symmetrically about the sagittal plane. The leg members 18 thus lie downwards across the central segment 60 or upwards towards the head portion 14.

The arm members 16 and the leg members 18, with the body portion 14 unfolded and arranged so that the first layer 30 faces upwards, are adapted to become further play elements of the play mat element 42.

At least one fastener 62 is also provided, and in this case, two said fasteners 62 are included. Each fastener 62 has a button 64 and a loop 66. In this embodiment, each loop 66 is provided on opposite sides of the head portion 12 so as to project from the top perimeter edge 54 of the unfolded body portion 14, and the respective buttons 64 are provided at or adjacent to the bottom corners of the central segment 60 on the first layer 30 of the unfolded body portion 14.

To fold the body portion 14, thereby creating the torso 68 of the child's toy 10, the changing mat element 44 is positioned facing up. The changing mat element 44 is folded in on its self in thirds along fold lines which are parallel with the sagittal plane, so that an outer first third 70 overlies a central third 72 of the body portion 14, and an outer second third 74 overlies the first third 70.

The partially folded body portion 14 is then folded again in thirds in a rolling manner from the bottom segments 76 up to the top segments 78 adjacent the head portion 12. In this way, the central segment 60 of the body portion 14 is presented on the front outer surface 80 of the toy's torso 68 or stomach. The body portion 14 is held in its folded condition by the fastener or fasteners 62 being engaged.

Due to the rolling up of the body portion 14, a muff 82 is formed which, when cold, allows a child's hands to be inserted laterally into the body portion 14 and through natural openings 84 between the folds. To promote this, any play elements on the said second third 74 of the folded body portion 14 are preferably of a comfortable fabric so as not to impede or agitate a child's hands when inserted into and withdrawn from the muff 82.
Although the fastener is a button and loop, other types of fastener can be considered, such as press stud or hook and loop.
The unfolded body portion is preferably square, but other shapes can be envisaged and may be feasible, such as rectangular.
The arm members and/or leg members may be dispensed with, for example, if the toy is shaped to represent an alien.

Although recycled material is conveniently made use of, other materials can be used. Fabric is preferred for the head portion and the play mat element, but other materials such as woven or non-woven materials or even plastics can be considered.

It is thus possible to provide a child's toy with a plurality of additional functions, including changing mat, play mat and muff. The changing mat, play mat and muff are all provided by a foldable body portion of the toy.

The embodiments described above are provided by way of examples only, and various other modifications will be apparent to persons skilled in the art without departing from the scope of the invention as defined in the appended claims.

claim.claim-text: Kinderspielzeug (10), umfassend einen einzelnen Kopf (12), einen faltbaren Körper (14) mit einer Oberseite, einer Unterseite und gegenüberliegenden Seiten, wobei der Kopf (12) oben am faltbaren Körper (14) angebracht ist, und zumindest ein Befestigungsmittel (62), um den Körper (14) lösbar in dessen gefaltetem Zustand zu halten, wobei der Kopf (12) zumindest ein Gesichtsmerkmal (20) enthält, und wobei der Körper (14) in einem nicht-gefalteten Zustand ein formbar biegsames Wickelauflagenelement (44) auf einer Hauptfläche (46) und ein formbar biegsames Spielflächenelement (42) auf der gegenüberliegenden Hauptfläche (38) aufweist, wobei sich der Kopf (12) von einer Kante des Wickelauflagenelements (44) erstreckt, wobei das Spielflächenelement (42) zumindest ein Spielelement (40) enthält, mit dem das Kind interagieren kann, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass der Körper (14) in einem gefalteten Zustand ein Muff (82) mit gegenüberliegenden Seitenöffnungen (84) für das Einführen von Händen bereitstellt, während der Kopf oben am Körper positioniert ist.
Kinderspielzeug (10) nach Anspruch 1, wobei der Kopf (12) mittig entlang der Kante des Wickelauflagenelements (44) angebracht ist.
Kinderspielzeug (10) nach Anspruch 1 oder 2, das darüber hinaus Armelemente (16) umfasst, die vom Kopf (12) beabstandet sind.

Kinderspielzeug (10) nach Anspruch 3, wobei die Armelemente (16) am Körper (14) angebracht sind, so dass sie sich von gegenüberliegenden Seiten erstrecken, wenn sich der Körper (14) in einem gefalteten und befestigten Zustand befindet, und einwärts vom einem Umfangsrand (34) beabstandet sind, wenn sich der Körper (14) in einem nicht-gefalteten Zustand befindet.
Kinderspielzeug (10) nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, das darüber hinaus Beinelemente (18) umfasst, die vom Kopf (12) beabstandet sind.

Kinderspielzeug (10) nach Anspruch 5, wobei die Beinelemente (18) am Körper (14) angebracht sind, so dass sie von einer Unterseite herabhängen, wenn sich der Körper (14) in einem gefalteten und befestigten Zustand befindet, und einwärts von einem Umfangsrand (34) beabstandet sind, wenn sich der Körper (14) in einem nicht-gefalteten Zustand befindet.
Kinderspielzeug (10) nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei eine Mehrzahl der Spielelemente (40) bereitgestellt ist.
Kinderspielzeug (10) nach Anspruch 7, wobei die Spielelemente (40) voneinander beabstandet sind.
Kinderspielzeug (10) nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei der Körper (14) in einem nicht-gefalteten Zustand im Wesentlichen viereckig ist.

Kinderspielzeug (10) nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei der nicht-gefaltete Körper (14) in Drittel faltbar und danach in Dritteln aufrollbar ist, so dass das erste Spielelement (40) auf der vorderen Außenseite (50) des Körpers (14) vorliegt, wenn sich dieser in seinem gefalteten und befestigten Zustand befindet.

Kinderspielzeug (10) nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei das erste Spielelement (40) auf der vorderen Außenseite (50) des Körpers (14) ist, wenn sich der Körper in seinem gefalteten und befestigten Zustand befindet.
Kinderspielzeug (10) nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei das erste Spielelement (40) mittig am Spielflächenelement (42) bereitgestellt ist.

Kinderspielzeug (10) nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei das Befestigungselement (62) zumindest einen Knopf (64) und eine entsprechende Öse enthält, wobei der Knopf (64) am Spielflächenelement (42) bereitgestellt ist und sich die Öse am Kopf (12) oder diesem benachbart befindet.

Kinderspielzeug (10) nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei in einem gefalteten Zustand der Muff (82) eine Durchgangsöffnung aus weichem Gewebe aufweist, die die Seitenöffnungen für das Aufnehmen der Hände miteinander verbindet.

A child's toy (10) comprising a distinct head (12), a foldable body (14) having a top, bottom and opposing sides, the head (12) being attached to the top of the foldable body (14), and at least one fastener (62) for releasably retaining the body (14) in its folded condition, the head (12) including at least one facial feature (20), and the body (14) when unfolded presenting a pliantly flexible changing mat element (44) on one major surface (46) and a pliantly flexible play mat element (42) on the opposite major surface (38), the head (12) extending from one edge of the changing mat element (44), the play mat element (42) including at least one play element (40) for a child to interact with, characterised in that the body (14), when folded, provides a muff (82) with opposing side openings (84) for hands insertion, whilst the head is positioned at the top of the body.
A child's toy (10) as claimed in claim 1, wherein the head (12) is attached midway along the said edge of the changing mat element (44).
A child's toy (10) as claimed in claim 1 or claim 2, further comprising arm members (16) which are spaced from the head (12).

A child's toy (10) as claimed in claim 3, wherein the arm members (16) are attached to the body (14) so that they extend from opposite sides when the body (14) is in a folded and fastened condition and are spaced inwardly from a perimeter edge (34) when the body (14) is in an unfolded condition.
A child's toy (10) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, further comprising leg members (18) which are spaced from the head (12).

A child's toy (10) as claimed in claim 5, wherein the leg members (18) are attached to the body (14) so that they depend from a lower side when the body (14) is in a folded and fastened condition and are spaced inwardly from a perimeter edge (34) when the body (14) is in an unfolded condition.
A child's toy (10) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein a plurality of said play elements (40) is provided.
A child's toy (10) as claimed in claim 7, wherein the play elements (40) are spaced from each other.
A child's toy (10) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein the body (14), when unfolded, is substantially square.

A child's toy (10) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein the unfolded body (14) is foldable into thirds, and then rollable in thirds to present the first said play element (40) on the front outer surface (50) of the body (14) when in its folded and fastened condition.

A child's toy (10) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein, when the body (14) is in its folded and fastened condition, the first said play element (40) is on the front outer surface (50) of the body (14).
A child's toy (10) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein the first said play element (40) is provided centrally on the play mat element (42).

A child's toy (10) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein the fastener (62) includes at least one button (64) and a corresponding eye, the button (64) being provided on the play mat element (42) and the eye being on or adjacent to the head (12).

A child's toy (10) as claimed in any one of the preceding claims, wherein, when folded, the muff (82) presents a soft fabric through-aperture which interconnects the side openings for receiving the hands.

Jouet pour enfant (10) comprenant une tête distincte (12), un corps pliable (14) ayant une partie supérieure, une partie inférieure et des côtés opposés, la tête (12) étant fixée à la partie supérieure du corps pliable (14), et au moins un organe de fixation (62) pour retenir de façon libérable le corps (14) dans son état plié, la tête (12) comprenant au moins une caractéristique faciale (20), et le corps (14), lorsqu'il est déplié, présentant un élément tapis à langer souple pliable (44) sur une surface principale (46) et un élément tapis de jeu souple pliable (42) sur la surface principale opposée (38), la tête (12) s'étendant à partir d'un bord de l'élément tapis à langer (44), l'élément tapis de jeu (42) comprenant au moins un élément de jeu (40) pour qu'un enfant interagisse avec, caractérisé par le fait que le corps (14), lorsqu'il est plié, comprend un manchon (82) ayant des ouvertures latérales opposées (84) pour l'introduction des mains, bien que la tête soit positionnée sur la partie supérieure du corps.
Jouet pour enfant (10) selon la revendication 1, dans lequel la tête (12) est fixée à mi-chemin le long dudit bord de l'élément tapis à langer (44).
Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une des revendications 1 ou 2, comprenant en outre des éléments bras (16) qui sont espacés de la tête (12).

Jouet pour enfant (10) selon la revendication 3, dans lequel les éléments bras (16) sont fixés au corps (14) de telle sorte qu'ils s'étendent à partir de côtés opposés lorsque le corps (14) est dans un état plié et fixé, et sont espacés vers l'intérieur à partir d'un bord périphérique (34) lorsque le corps (14) est dans un état déplié.
Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, comprenant en outre des éléments jambes (18) qui sont espacés de la tête (12).

Jouet pour enfant (10) selon la revendication 5, dans lequel les éléments jambes (18) sont fixés au corps (14) de telle sorte qu'ils pendent à partir d'un côté inférieur lorsque le corps (14) est dans un état plié et fixé, et sont espacés vers l'intérieur à partir d'un bord périphérique (34) lorsque le corps (14) est dans un état déplié.
Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel une pluralité desdits éléments de jeu (40) est prévue.
Jouet pour enfant (10) selon la revendication 7, dans lequel les éléments de jeu (40) sont espacés les uns des autres.
Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel le corps (14), lorsqu'il est déplié, est sensiblement carré.

Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel le corps déplié (14) est repliable en trois, puis apte à être roulé en trois pour présenter ledit premier élément de jeu (40) sur la surface extérieure avant (50) du corps (14) lorsqu'il est dans son état plié et fixé.

Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel, lorsque le corps (14) est dans son état plié et fixé, ledit premier élément de jeu (40) est sur la surface extérieure avant (50) du corps (14).
Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel ledit premier élément de jeu (40) est disposé au centre sur l'élément de tapis de jeu (42).

Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel l'organe de fixation (62) comprend au moins un bouton (64) et un oeil correspondant, le bouton (64) étant disposé sur l'élément tapis de jeu (42) et l'oeil étant sur ou adjacent à la tête (12).

Jouet pour enfant (10) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel, lorsqu'il est plié, le manchon (82) présente une ouverture traversante en tissu souple qui relie entre elles les ouvertures latérales pour recevoir les mains.
